p: CoRSV shares a pattern of emergence observed with numerous other plant viruses in being described decades ago and then rising into prominence as cultural and environmental conditions conducive to range expansion of their vectors are met with increasing frequency [ 5, 6]. First documented in 1938 [ 7], CoRSV is now established over the majority of coffee growing regions in Brazil [ 8]. A survey of some of these regions found CoRSV on 100% (n = 45) of the farms visited. Although the incidence of CoRSV varied greatly from farm to farm, the ease by which the virus could be found at every location was a significant and surprising finding.
